results.title: Wild at heart
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Joni Sighvatsson, Steve Golin, Monty Montgomery and PolyGram Propaganda Productions
results.brief_description: The story of Sailor (Nicolas Cage) and Lula (Laura Dern), young lovers on the run from the law, with Lula’s insanely obsessive mother (Diane Ladd) who will stop at nothing to keep them apart. This is a film about dark obsessions, murderous secrets and torrid passion. A truly gothic Road Movie. Also stars Willem Dafoe, Harry Dean Stanton and Isabella Rossellini. Based on the novel by Barry Gifford.

results.title: Wild Africa: the energy cycle
results.creator_credit: James Murray, William Banting and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This film discusses the flow of energy from green plants through the herbivores and carnivores of the African plains. Various herbivores are shown eating and these in turn are food for carnivores. Concentrates on the flow of food energy. Taken from the orginal production entitled ‘Wild Africa: as it was’.

results.title: Wild about wilderness
results.creator_credit: David Greig and Kestrel Films & Video (Australia)
results.brief_description: Debora Conway hosts this video which attempts to define wilderness areas that are left. All wilderness areas shown are from New South Wales. Finishes with the sobering thought that what we don’t save now is lost for ever.

results.title: Wilbur wants to kill himself [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lone Scherfig, Sisse Olsen and Zentropa Entertainment6
results.brief_description: Set in Glasgow with Danish production “Wilbur wants to kill himself” is a bittersweet tale. Wilbur (Jamie Sives) has failed many attempts at suicide and having inherited a second hand book store is distracted from his morbid thoughts by an interesting customer. Supplementing her income by selling old books found in doctors waiting rooms Alice (Shirley Henderson) becomes part of Wilbur’s life. A charming comedy drama. Cast also includes Adrian Rawlings, Lisa McKinlay, Mads Mikkelson, Julia Davis and Susan Vidler.

results.title: Wilber
results.creator_credit: Laura Hunter and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A spooky story of trickery and revenge, where good overcomes evil. Uses claymation and computer animation.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Wigglemen tales: good goodies
results.creator_credit: Charlie O. Hayward and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: An animated film which demonstrates the effect of advertising and the power of words on the businessman and the consumer. Tells the story of two trucks selling “goodies” as they compete with each other for customers by erecting more and more advertising atop their trucks.

results.title: Widows
results.brief_description: The widows of three men killed while trying to steal a famous painting, join forces to find their husband’s killers and finish off the job of stealing the painting.
results.description: The widows of three men killed while trying to steal a famous painting, join forces to find their husband’s killers and finish off the job of stealing the painting.

results.title: Widows
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2018
results.brief_description: A police shootout leaves four thieves dead during an explosive armed robbery attempt in Chicago. Their widows have nothing in common except a debt left behind by their spouses’ criminal activities. Hoping to forge a future on their own terms, they join forces to pull off a heist.

constellations_other.name: Women, crime and literature
constellations_other.description: Judy & Punch draws on a classic puppet show that's been reframed by director Mirrah Foulkes as a feminist tale, much like the works that put women at the centre in this Constellation.

results.title: Widows
results.brief_description: Widows was a British primetime television serial aired in 1983, produced by Euston Films for Thames Television and aired on the ITV network. The six-part series revolved was written by crime writer Lynda La Plante.

constellations_other.name: Women, crime and literature
constellations_other.description: Judy & Punch draws on a classic puppet show that's been reframed by director Mirrah Foulkes as a feminist tale, much like the works that put women at the centre in this Constellation.

results.description:
Widows was a British primetime television serial aired in 1983, produced by Euston Films for Thames Television and aired on the ITV network.

The six-part series revolved was written by crime writer Lynda La Plante. The executive producer was Verity Lambert.

The haunting music that was heard at intervals throughout series 1 and in the final credits of Widows 2, is “What Is Life to Me Without Thee” from the opera L’Orfeo, sung here by Kathleen Ferrier.
description_for_label:
Widows was a British primetime television serial aired in 1983, produced by Euston Films for Thames Television and aired on the ITV network.

The six-part series revolved was written by crime writer Lynda La Plante. The executive producer was Verity Lambert.

The haunting music that was heard at intervals throughout series 1 and in the final credits of Widows 2, is “What Is Life to Me Without Thee” from the opera L’Orfeo, sung here by Kathleen Ferrier.

results.title: Wide pastures
results.creator_credit: Robert Kingsbury, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Australia’s most enduring industry is the development, breeding and grazing of the Australian merino sheep. A pastoral revolution based on land clearing, top-dressing and irrigation is increasing sheep production over vast new areas, but the traditional outback has hardly changed since farmers went inland to find sheep country.
